conclusion: Analyze forces on sliders to calculate force preventing upward sliding and determine external force F.
Two sliders A and B connected by rope on inclined plane; slider A at base, slider B higher up; force F applied to slider B; incline angle 37 degrees.
Mass of each slider is m, gravitational acceleration is g.
Force of kinetic friction between slider and plane is mu mg, where mu is 0.5.
Component of weight acting down incline is 0.6mg.
For sliders not to slide upwards, kinetic friction force must balance weight component down incline: mu mg = 0.6mg.
Force F applied to slider B must balance kinetic friction force: F = mu mg = 0.3mg.
Magnitude of external force F is 0.3mg.
